item.title: Hosea 1
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 1

1 Messages from Yahveh to Hosea Ben-Beeri at the Time of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, Kings of Judah, and Jeroboam Ben-Joash/Jehoash, King of Israel Hosea’s Wife and Children

2 When Yahveh spoke the first time through Hosea, he said, “Marry a prostitute and have children, because the land is committing flagrant prostitution by abandoning me.” 3So he married Gomer Bat Diblaim, and she had a son. 4Yahveh said, “Name him Jezreel. Soon I’ll punish Jehu’s dynasty for the bloodshed in Jezreel, and put an end to Israel. 5At that time, I’ll break Israel’s military strength in the Valley of ‘Jezreel.’"

item.title: Hosea 2
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 2

1 In that day, you will call your brothers ‘Ammi’ [my people] and your sisters ‘Ruhamah’ [the ones loved].’

2 But for now, bring charges against your mother Israel because she’s not my wife and I’m not her husband. Let her put away her prostitution, the adultery from between her breasts.

3 Otherwise, I’ll strip her naked and expose her like the day she was born. I’ll make her like a wilderness, like a desert; she’ll die of thirst.

item.title: Hosea 3
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 3

1 Then Yahveh told me, “Go love your wife again even though she’s an adulteressâ€”like I love Israel though it turns to other gods and loves raisin cakes.” 2So I bought her for 6 oz 15 shekels of silver and 5 bushels a lethek of barley. 3I told her, “You’ll have to stay with me a long time. You won’t carry on prostitution or belong to another man. I’ll be that way with you too.” 4That’s because the people in Israel will go a long time without king or prince, sacrifice or sacred pillar, ephod or household idols. 5Then they’ll come back and rely on Yahveh their God and David their king. They’ll come cringing to Yahveh and to his goodness in the end. Yahveh Accuses Israel

item.title: Hosea 4
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 4

1 Israel, listen to Yahveh’s message; he’s filing charges against you: “There’s no faithfulness, kindness, or awareness of God there.

2 There’s swearing, deception, murder, stealing, and adultery; they use violence, so there’s murder after murder.

3 So the land is in mourning. Everybody that lives in it is wasting away, along with the animals in the field and the birds in the sky; even the fish are disappearing.” 4"But don’t anybody point a finger at somebody else; I’m suing you priests.

item.title: Hosea 5
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 5

1 Hear this, priests! Pay attention, Israel! Listen, family of the king! Your idolatry at Mizpah has set a trap and cast a net on Tabor.

2 You rebels have gone deep in slaughter, but I’ll punish you all for it.

3 I know what you’re doing, Ephraim; you can’t hide from me, Israel. Ephraim, you’ve left me like a prostitute; Israel, you’ve defiled yourself.

4 Your deeds keep you from coming back to me. You’re totally a prostitute; you don’t know Yahveh. 5"Israel’s arrogance testifies against him; Israel and Ephraim stumble under the weight of their guilt; Judah stumbles with them.

item.title: Hosea 6
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 6

1 They’ll say, ‘Let’s return to Yahveh. He has torn us, but he’ll heal us; he has wounded us, but he’ll bandage us up.

2 He’ll revive us in two days, and raise us up the third, so we can live in his presence.

3 So let’s press on to know Yahveh. He’ll respond to us as sure as dawn comes; he’ll come to us like rain, like the spring rain that waters the ground.’ 4"What am I going to do with you, Ephraim, or with you, Judah? Your loyalty is like a morning cloud, like dew that evaporates early.

item.title: Hosea 7
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 7

1 When I would heal Israel, Ephraim’s sin gets uncovered, Samaria’s evil deeds as well, because they’re devious. Thieves go inside; bandits raid outside.

2 They don’t realize that I remember their sinfulness. Their deeds are all around them; they’re right in front of me. 3"They entertain the king with their sinfulness, and the officials laugh at their lies.

4 They’re adulterers, like an oven heated by bakers that keep the fire going from the kneading of the dough till it’s risen.

item.title: Hosea 8
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 8

1 Put the bugle to your lips! A vulture is swooping down on Yahveh’s Temple because my people have broken my covenant and disobeyed my Law.

2 Israel pleads with me, ‘We know you; you’re our God!’

3 Israel has rejected what’s good; so his enemies will chase him.

4 He’s set up kings, but not by me; he’s appointed officials, but I didn’t know it. By making idols out of his silver and gold, he’s gotten himself destroyed. 5"I’ve rejected your calf, Samaria, and said, ‘My anger burns against you! How long will you not be capable of innocence?

item.title: Hosea 9
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 9

1 Israel, don’t celebrate like other nations; you’ve carried on prostitution by leaving your God. You’ve loved prostitutes’ earnings on every threshing floor.

2 Threshing floor and winepress won’t feed you; you won’t have any new wine.

3 You won’t remain in Yahveh’s land; you’ll return to Egypt and eat unclean food in Assyria.

4 You won’t be pouring out liquid offerings of wine to Yahveh there; your sacrifices won’t please him. Your bread will be unclean like mourners’ bread; everybody that eats it will be defiled because it will only be for your hunger; you can’t bring it to Yahveh’s Temple.

item.title: Hosea 10
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 10

1 Israel is a luxurious vine that grows his own fruit. The more his fruit, the more altars he makes; the better his land, the better the sacred pillars he sets up.

2 He’s been unfaithful; now he must pay for his guilt. Yahveh is going to tear down his altars and pull over his sacred pillars.

3 Then they’ll say, “We don’t have a king because we didn’t respect Yahveh; even if we had one, what could he do for us?"

item.title: Hosea 11
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 11

1 When Israel was young, I loved him and called my son out of Egypt.

2 The more I called him, the more he withdrew from me. He kept sacrificing to images of Baal and burning incense to idols.

3 But I was the One that taught Ephraim to walk, leading him by the hand; but he didn’t know I was the One that healed him.

4 I led him with the leashes of mercy and bonds of love; I became like One that eased the bridle from his jaws and bent over to feed him. 5"My people won’t go back to Egypt; Assyria will be their king because they refused to come back to me.

item.title: Hosea 12
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 12

1 Ephraim feeds on wind, and constantly chases after the east wind; he piles up lies and violence; he even makes an alliance with Assyria while he’s carrying olive oil to Egypt to buy help. Yahveh’s Indictment Against Israel and Judah

2 Yahveh has a dispute with Judah too; he’ll punish Jacob in proportion to his “deceit."

3 In the womb he grabbed his brother’s heel; when he grew up, he even wrestled with God.

item.title: Hosea 13
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 13

1 When Ephraim spoke, people cringed; he made himself important in Israel, but because of Baal he became guilty and died.

2 Now his people sin more and more and make molten images, idols skillfully formed from silver, all made by craftsmen. They say, “Sacrifice to them, kiss the calf idols!"

3 So they’ll be like morning mist, like dew that dries off soon, like chaff blown from a threshing floor, like smoke from a chimney. 4"Yet I’ve been Yahveh your God since Egypt; you weren’t to know any God but me because there is no savior but me.

item.title: Hosea 14
item.description:
Hosea Chapter 14

1 Israel, come back to Yahveh your God; you’ve stumbled because you sinned.

2 Come back to Yahveh and bring your confession with you. Say, “Take away our sin; receive us graciously so we can offer our praises to you.

3 Assyria can’t save us; neither can our warhorses. We won’t say ‘our god’ anymore to something we’ve made; only from you can we orphans receive mercy."
